We are asking Leader Pelosi to publicly support the following ideas of the ‚ÄúBreak the Gridlock‚Äù rules changes that we first proposed in June to help spur immediate action on health care, immigration, and infrastructure:

The bottom line is this: We need real rules reform to get bipartisan legislation heard ‚Äî not just more committees to study the problem. Bipartisan legislation with broad support deserves honest debate and a simple up-or-down vote.

If we are going to get anything done and move New Jersey forward, we will have to work together. With health care, immigration, infrastructure, and jobs on the line, we simply can‚Äôt afford two more years of gridlock.
The reality is that we are now living in an era of divided government. Come January, Democrats will lead the House, but the Senate and White House will continue to be controlled by Republicans.
Our rules proposal isn't about changing leadership; it's about changing a system that stymies the will of the common sense majority.

For six months now, the Problem Solvers has focused on changing the House rules, so we can finally get action on infrastructure (fixing our roads, tunnels and bridges), health care (premiums down), and immigration reform (allowing DREAMERs to stay and keeping our borders secure).
As with anything, there‚Äôs plenty of misinformation, so I thought I‚Äôd clarify a few things.

I‚Äôve heard from many of you about my fight to change some of the House rules to get bipartisan legislation accomplished. The outpouring of support for the Caucus' effort has been incredible. Thank you.
